processing.video

Class Movie

  • java.lang.Object
    • processing.core.PImage
      • processing.video.Movie
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, processing.core.PConstants

    public class Movie
extends processing.core.PImage
implements processing.core.PConstants
    Datatype for storing and playing movies. Movies must be located in the sketch's data folder or an accessible place on the network to load without an error.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Movie

        public Movie(processing.core.PApplet parent,
             java.lang.String filename)
        Creates an instance of Movie loading the movie from filename.
        Parameters:
        parent - PApplet
        filename - String

    • Method Detail

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Disposes all the native resources associated to this movie. NOTE: This is not official API and may/will be removed at any time.

      • frameRate

        public void frameRate(float ifps)
        Sets how often frames are read from the movie. Setting the fps parameter to 4, for example, will cause 4 frames to be read per second.
        Parameters:
        ifps - speed of the movie in frames per second

      • speed

        public void speed(float irate)
        Sets the relative playback speed of the movie. The rate parameters sets the speed where 2.0 will play the movie twice as fast, 0.5 will play at half the speed, and -1 will play the movie in normal speed in reverse.
        Parameters:
        irate - speed multiplier for movie playback

      • duration

        public float duration()
        Returns the length of the movie in seconds. If the movie is 1 minute and 20 seconds long the value returned will be 80.0.

      • time

        public float time()
        Returns the location of the playback head in seconds. For example, if the movie has been playing for 4 seconds, the number 4.0 will be returned.

      • jump

        public void jump(float where)
        Jumps to a specific location within a movie. The parameter where is in terms of seconds. For example, if the movie is 12.2 seconds long, calling jump(6.1) would go to the middle of the movie.
        Parameters:
        where - position to jump to specified in seconds

      • available

        public boolean available()
        Returns "true" when a new movie frame is available to read.

      • play

        public void play()
        Plays a movie one time and stops at the last frame.

      • loop

        public void loop()
        Plays a movie continuously, restarting it when it's over.

      • noLoop

        public void noLoop()
        If a movie is looping, calling noLoop() will cause it to play until the end and then stop on the last frame.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Pauses a movie during playback. If a movie is started again with play(), it will continue from where it was paused.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops a movie from continuing. The playback returns to the beginning so when a movie is played, it will begin from the beginning.

      • read

        public void read()
        Reads the current frame of the movie.

      • volume

        public void volume(float v)
        Change the volume. Values are from 0 to 1.
        Parameters:
        float - v

      • loadPixels

        public void loadPixels()
        Loads the pixel data for the image into its pixels[] array.
        Overrides:
        loadPixels in class processing.core.PImage

      • get

        public int get(int x,
               int y)
        Reads the color of any pixel or grabs a section of an image.
        Overrides:
        get in class processing.core.PImage

      • isPlaying

        public boolean isPlaying()
        Check if this movie object is currently playing.

      • isPaused

        public boolean isPaused()
        Check if this movie object is currently paused.

      • isLooping

        public boolean isLooping()
        Check if this movie object is currently looping.

      • setBufferSink

        public void setBufferSink(java.lang.Object sink)
        Sets the object to use as destination for the frames read from the stream. The color conversion mask is automatically set to the one required to copy the frames to OpenGL. NOTE: This is not official API and may/will be removed at any time.
        Parameters:
        Object - dest

      • hasBufferSink

        public boolean hasBufferSink()
        NOTE: This is not official API and may/will be removed at any time.

      • disposeBuffer

        public void disposeBuffer(java.lang.Object buf)
        NOTE: This is not official API and may/will be removed at any time.

      • post

        public void post()
